item.title: Activision Releases New Black Ops 7 Patch With Weapons Update
item.content:encoded:
Activision has released another new patch for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7. This update features a number of adjustments to Black Ops 7’s multiplayer, end game, and weapons throughout.

Weapons getting updates include the Maddox RFB, M15 MOD 0, AK-27, Sturmwolf 45, XR-3 Ion and more. Elswehere, the update features changes to four maps, one perk, one equipment, and other areas.

Check out the details of the update below, and leave your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord server.

Black Ops 7 January 13 Patch

General

  • Base Sprint to Sprint Fire Time (used with Gung Ho perk) now matches base Sprint to Fire Time for all weapons.

Assault Rifles

Maddox RFB

General Adjustments

  • Recoil increased
  • All movement speeds reduced by 0.05 m/s

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 28
    • Range: 0–12.7m (was 0–19.1m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 19
    • Range: 12.8–27.9m (was 19.2–33m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 16
    • Range: >27.9m (was >33m ↓)

Maddox RFB – 13″ MFS Echo-Fire Barrel

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 23
    • Range: 0–20.3m (was 0–22.9m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 19
    • Range: 20.3–34.3m (was 30–36.8m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 16
    • Range: >34.3m

Additional Adjustments

  • Recoil increased

M15 MOD 0

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 21
    • Range: 0–30.5m (was 0–38.1m ↓)
  • Medium Damage: 18
    • Range: 30.5–46.4m (was 38.2–46.4m ↓)
  • Minimum Damage: 17
    • Range: >46.4m

Additional Adjustments

  • Slide-to-Fire increased: 420ms → 430ms
  • Hip Spread increased by 0.1°
  • All movement speeds reduced by 0.05 m/s

16″ Reticulated Barrel

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.55x → 1.6x

AK-27 (Battle-Scar Conversion)

Conversion Adjustments

  • Fire Rate penalty reduced: 100% → 70%
  • Movement penalties removed
  • ADS penalty reduced: 60ms → 30ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire penalty reduced: 60ms → 30ms
  • Fixed Comb attachment persistence issue

X9 Maverick

14.6″ MFS Pulse Load+ Barrel

  • Damage Range penalty reduced: 25% → 13%
  • ADS improvement increased: 20ms → 30ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire improvement increased: 15ms → 25ms
  • Movement Speed bonus increased by 0.03 m/s

DS20 Mirage

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 27
    • Range: 0–22.9m (was 0–20.3m ↑)
  • Medium Damage: 23
    • Range: 23–44.5m
  • Minimum Damage: 22
    • Range: >44.5m

Mirage Tandem Launcher Adjustments

  • Burst delay improved: 350ms → 300ms
  • Swap time improved: 550ms → 420ms

Submachine Guns (SMGs)

Sturmwolf 45

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 30 (was 29 ↑)
  • Other damage ranges unchanged

Additional Adjustments

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.2x → 1.26x

15″ Regnant Barrel

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.25x → 1.35x
  • Vertical recoil penalty reduced: 45% → 30%
  • Horizontal recoil penalty reduced: 20% → 15%

Sturmwolf 45 – MFS Tigris .40 Cal Mag

Damage Adjustments

  • Medium Damage Range 2: 23 (was 22 ↑)

Additional Adjustments

  • Headshot multiplier increased: 1.2x → 1.26x
  • Vertical recoil penalty reduced: 80% → 65%
  • Horizontal recoil penalty reduced: 40% → 30%
  • Recoil deviation penalty reduced: 50% → 35%

Kogot-7

Damage Adjustments

  • Minimum damage reduced: 14 → 13

Ryden 45K

General Adjustments

  • Reduced gun kick and view kick harshness

Razor 9mm

12″ MFS Sidewinder Barrel

  • Horizontal & vertical recoil improvement increased: 10% → 25%
  • Recoil stabilization increased: 15% → 25%
  • ADS penalty increased: 15ms → 20ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire penalty increased: 15ms → 20ms

Dravec 45

Damage Adjustments

  • All damage ranges reduced across the board

Additional Adjustments

  • ADS time increased: 230ms → 235ms

Carbon 57

Damage Adjustments

  • Maximum Damage: 23 (was 22 ↑)
  • Medium Damage 1: 19 (was 18 ↑)
  • Medium Damage 2: 16 (was 15 ↑)
  • Minimum Damage: 14 (was 13 ↑)

Handling Adjustments

  • ADS: 240ms → 245ms
  • Sprint-to-Fire: 170ms → 180ms
  • Tactical Sprint-to-Fire: 290ms → 300ms
  • Slide-to-Fire: 360ms → 380ms
  • Dive-to-Fire: 440ms → 460ms
  • Fixed iron sight ADS alignment

MPC-25

General Adjustments

  • Reduced random gun kick and view kick deviation

Kühn Ported Comp

  • Sprint Fire Hip Spread bonus reduced: 25% → 15%

8.6″ MFS Stratus-X Barrel

  • Range increased across all damage tiers

VAS Tactical Scale Stock

  • Sprint Fire Hip Spread bonus reduced: 15% → 10%

LMGs

Sokol 545

General Adjustments

  • Reduced recoil on default fire mode
  • Reduced View Kick strength and deviation on fast fire mode

Marksman Rifles

M8A1

MFS Striker Tactical Stock

  • Tac Stance spread bonus increased: 63% → 66%
  • Flinch penalty reduced: 40% → 18%

2mw Adaptive Tactical Laser

  • Tac Stance aim walking speed increased: 0.4 → 0.9 m/s

Sniper Rifles

XR-3 Ion

General Adjustments

  • Improved shot queuing window to prevent accidental follow-up bursts

Pistols

Velox 5.7

4″ MFS Celeste Barrel

  • Hip Spread improved by 15%
  • Jumping/Landing stability increased: 40% → 60%
  • Fixed Swap Speed bonus not applying

CODA 9

General Adjustments

  • Adaptive Discharge Mod and MFS DeltaCell Bulk Mag can no longer be equipped together

Launchers

A.R.C. M1

General Adjustments

  • Shots no longer queue during overheat cooldown

Special Weapons

NX Ravager

General Adjustments

  • Fixed projectile velocity and arc inconsistencies

Melee Weapons

Ballistic Knife

General Adjustments

  • Weapon no longer auto-stows when out of ammo
  • Remains equipped after last blade is fired

Multiplayer

Maps  

  • Fringe
    • Added collision to areas where players could get out of the map.
  • Yakei
    • Added collision to an area where players could get out of the map. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Meltdown
    • Added collision to an area where players could get out of the map. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Flagship
    • Flagship has been temporarily removed from the map pool due to a stability issue. (Added Jan. 9)

Perks  

  • Bankroll
    • Closed an exploit where Bankroll could grant all Perks when using the Specialist Wildcard. (Added Jan. 9)

Equipment  

  • Stim Shot
    • Addressed an issue preventing XP Progression on the Stim Shot Overclock. Stim Shot will now also gain progress when healing at least 10HP.

Audio 

  • Reduced the frequency of Announcer voice lines in The Ghouls.

Stability 

  • Addressed stability issues when using the Rhino Scorestreak. (Added Jan. 9)
  • Added various stability fixes.

Zombies

UI 

  • Addressed an issue where the After Action Report could show an Armory unlock for the NX Ravager after the player had already unlocked it.

Stability

  • Added various stability fixes.

Endgame

Gameplay

  • Addressed an issue where party members could be pulled out of the Endgame cinematic early and lose their loadout after defeating Faulkner when in a party.
  • Addressed an issue where calling in a Rhino or Power Armor while holding a melee weapon would cause the player to lose their Exotic weapon and melee weapon rarity.
  • Addressed an issue where Supply Crates could be opened more than once.

For more Insider Gaming, read about more footage from Monolith’s canceled Batman game appearing online. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

item.title: Tarkov Lead Teases New Sci-Fi Apocalypse Game That Has Everyone Confused
item.content:encoded:
Escape from Tarkov fans have been left bewildered by the latest string of social media posts from Nikita Buyanov, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games. He recently unveiled a social profile created in 2024 linked to a website for a fictional entity named ‘CORE Corp’, and heading to that website uncovers a wealth of information.

At first blush, it appears to be an entirely new game, rooted in a sci-fi, interplanetary universe where Earth has been left partially destroyed by some unseen cataclysm and rendered radioactive. There are daily challenges to resolve, modules to unlock, AI characters to talk to, and stacks of mysteries to unravel.

What is COR3.GG?

COR3.gg is the webpage that Escape from Tarkov lead, Nikita Buyanov, linked his followers to earlier today. It’s mocked up to look like a retro-futuristic computer interface, like something you’d find in Fallout or ARC Raiders.

Once you’ve completed the very basic login puzzle (by entering your email and getting an OTP), you’ll be given a unique identifier that you’ll need to hold on to. This will get you into the system if you happen to log out inadvertently.

The ‘CORIE’ operating system you’re exposed to will now present you with a string of options. You can check messages, interact with a virtual (but locked-down) browser, see that the weather is apocalyptic, and listen to a gravelly radio. There’s a notepad, an updater module, and a series of daily challenges that involve probing strings of files and attempting to figure out what the errors in them are.

CORIE appears to be set in 2251, or thereabouts. There are ‘logs’ from the player character that serve as a little backstory to CORIE, or COR3, whatever it’s called:

Today is my first day as a private investigator for “History Unfolded”.

The contract has been signed and all the terms agreed for. But I am still shocked about how smooth that went. Those people … the “handler” – they didn’t even ask that many questions. It seemed like they knew me for quite some time. And that Aurana chick … stunning but dangerous. She gives me chills.

How did I even get here … have been asking that myself for several days now. Guess wanting something new and mysterious can sometimes lead to such adventures.

The main goal of that “contract” is to uncover some old mysteries it seems. But I wonder if those are truly a secret for the people who hired me, because they seem to be very well informed. Like having deep knowledge on most events.

Maybe they are looking for an alternative opinion, or maybe they found something interesting in my personality and skill set … Honestly, I am not sure I would even like to know.

An on-site ’employment contract’ reveals that you’ve been hired by Aurana Strogova, and that you’re tasked with ‘uncovering the files related to experiments that took place on -redacted- from 2170 to present time.’

The entire thing is quite bizarre.

The top screen for CORIE looks to be set in some kind of underground bunker. You can interact with the environment, studying various items that are described from a first-person perspective. There’s a junk box full of scrap, a ventilation system, and various pieces of armor, including a mining helmet.

One of the item descriptions reads:

Darkhound ‘Oppressor’ Modular Plate Carrier

A universal plate carrier from a legendary company known throughout the solar system. I’ve taken it everywhere, wherever it’s weapon-based environment.

It smacks of ARC Raiders crossed with Fallout, as I mentioned before, but it’s interplanetary. There’s talk of space elevators, cargo ships adrift in the great beyond around nearby planets like Venus, and talk of immense death-ray-sounding weapons built to intimidate and deter space pirates.

There’s a full-fledged space council, a navy equipped with battle cruisers, and the back stories of several characters are explored at length.

In one section, a faction called Alternative Future can be uncovered, but it’s said that to find out more information, you’ll need to ‘visit any one of (their) outposts.’

This is all very confusing, and fans of Escape from Tarkov and Battlestate Games have been left bewildered. While more information is dug up, it’s worth heading over to COR3.gg and seeing what you can uncover.

Are you as confused as everyone else about Nikita Buyanov’s new game? Let us know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Meta has closed multiple studios

Grant's passion for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC when he wasn't even old enough to walk properly. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with an undying love for the…

item.title: Deadpool Is Marvel Rivals’ Most Versatile Character
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals Deadpool can play 3 roles: Duelist, Vanguard, and Strategist, and you can choose which role you want to play.

Season 6 of Marvel Rivals, Night at the Museum, is all set to kick off on January 16, 2026, and it will finally bring the most anticipated character to the game, Deadpool. The developers have now released their Dev Vision Vol. 13, which goes over the new characters along with all the new content and changes coming to Marvel Rivals Season 6.

Marvel Rivals Deadpool Features 3 Roles in One

The latest Dev Vision Vol. 13 started very differently from the previous Marvel Rivals dev diary. In the most Deadpool fashion, the Merc with the Mouth stepped into Guangguang’s role and walked us through his character details himself. Deadpool first addressed the complaints about the game not having enough Vanguard and Strategists, revealing that he is the solution, as Deadpool can play as a Duelist, Vanguard, and Strategist in Marvel Rivals.

Deadpool features Dual Pistols and Dual Katanas, allowing him to battle the enemies at range and up close and take up the Duelist role. As a Vanguard, the character has a unicorn plushie that can give out shields. Lastly, the Dual Pistols and Dual Katanas can not only damage enemies but also heal allies when shooting at them as a Strategist.

Additionally, Deadpool in Marvel Rivals can level up while the battle goes on until he becomes a “true server admin”, no matter which role you pick. The character’s ultimate ability charges faster depending on “how fancy” the player fights, which leads to a challenge to other players. Depending on how the players answer Deadpool’s questions, the character will receive a huge buff according to the role he is playing.

What are your thoughts on Deadpool being able to take on 3 different roles in Marvel Rivals? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Carmageddon: Rogue Shift receiving a new gameplay trailer. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Carmageddon: Rogue Shift Gets New Gameplay Trailer
item.content:encoded:
Developer 34BigThings has released a new gameplay trailer for the upcoming Carmageddon: Rogue Shift.

Announced back in early December 2025, Carmageddon: Rogue Shit releases on February 6 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2, and PC.

“Carmageddon smashes back with brutal roguelite vehicular‑combat mayhem,” the game’s description reads. “Adapt, upgrade, and unleash destruction on post‑apocalyptic zombie hordes. The legacy lives on, reinvented and unforgiving.”

The game sees players go through a roguelite campaign with branching event maps, dynamic challenges and permanent progression between runs. There will be 15 upgradeable vehicles that range from tanks to hot rods with 13 weapon classes and over 80 perks to equip to your vehicle.

With it being a roguelite game, 34BigThings say that every run through the campaign will offer a “unique journey through a randomly generated graph.” There will also be branching patches, a variety of objections, and dynamic time of day and weather to make sure each run is different.

You can check out the gameplay trailer for yourself, below, and leave your thoughts down in the comments and over at the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about more footage from Monolith’s canceled Batman game appearing online. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…
